row-cutting your yarn at the end of each one and joining with your new color at the beginning x in row 2 change to color b the means double_crochet into the front loop of the corresponding stitch 2 row below and the means single_crochet into back loop of the current row so as you work the row from right to left you will work 5 double_crochet 4 single_crochet 4 double_crochet 4 single_crochet 3 double_crochet row 3 final product here is a picture of row 3 for reference ©2021 heather noble designs border stitch bs you will need a border stitch at the beginning and end of each row starting in row 2 to make your row secure this is the original method i also have an updated version see stitch key for video tutorial links for both methods beginning bs insert hook under both loops of first stitch join new yarn and chain 1 single_crochet into same stitch both loops to complete the border stitch *for ending bs repeat this process in reverse single_crochet through both loops then ch1 cut yarn ©2021 heather noble designs stitch key 1 i have created many of the stitches and notation system in my designs there is not a current standard notation system for mosaic overlay crochet so please
